item.title: How not to lead
item.description: America’s allies may comply for now. But the damage to trust will have consequences.

item.title: Leave the fascism debate behind
item.description: Better ideas are more important than dire warnings about Trump as dictator.

item.title: Improve the IRS by giving it less to do
item.description: A simpler tax code would be easier to understand and enforce.

item.title: A toxic tonic
item.description: Michael Ramirez cartoon on the snake oil of Republicans and big government.

item.title: Democrats finally abandon Bill Clinton
item.description: A bipartisan House committee held Bill and Hillary Clinton in contempt of Congress. Amazing.

item.title: What to ask yourself if you think you may be drinking too much
item.description: Responding to reader questions about the risks of alcohol use.

item.title: Europe has stopped pretending
item.description: Trump’s wrecking ball creates new determination to address the continent’s long-festering problems.

item.title: DHS: No judicial warrant? No problem.
item.description: Any legal novice could point out the problem with the Trump administration’s view on warrants.

item.title: Plato’s fall to culture wars carries a troubling irony
item.description: ‘Members Only: Palm Beach,’ free speech, university board independence and whale protections, in readers’ eyes.

item.title: Jamie Dimon’s modest proposal
item.description: If Warren and Sanders think capping credit card interest rates is a good idea, try it first in their states.

item.title: Antisemitism is permeating everyday life
item.description: Jewish people know what it means when threats are tolerated until they become irreversible.

item.title: DOGE defiled the cause of government efficiency
item.description: A fishing expedition at the Social Security Administration raises privacy concerns.

item.title: Sheinbaum’s Cuba policy is testing Washington’s patience
item.description: Supporting Havana’s murderous regime could carry real costs in trade talks and security ties.

item.title: There’s a practical way to lower housing prices. Democrats should seize it.
item.description: Affordability is a goal, not a policy.

item.title: This obsession has held Iran back for a half-century
item.description: Time and again, idealism untethered from reality has brought ruin to Iran.

item.title: Mamdani prefers protest over leadership
item.description: The New York mayor’s job is to fix problems, not escalate tensions between business and workers.

item.title: On ICE oversight, something is better than nothing
item.description: The DHS funding bill implements modest oversight measures for ICE, but liberals hope to torpedo it.

item.title: Trump finds a Greenland offramp
item.description: At Davos, the president defuses a crisis he created.

item.title: Brett Kavanaugh reminds Republicans: What goes around comes around
item.description: The justice points out the likely consequences if President Trump can summarily fire a Fed governor.

item.title: Calling Trump’s actions unprecedented is a good story. But it’s not true.
item.description: Donald Trump’s immigration crackdown and D.C. women’s hockey, in readers’ eyes.

item.title: Message to Trump and the GOP: Pro-life voters are watching
item.description: A “flexible” approach to reducing abortion will have a cost in the midterms.

item.title: Cartoon by Matt Davies
item.description: Matt Davies cartoon on Trump, Greenland, blue states, foreign policy.
